Service Manual

220 - 300 psi45 psi at the beginning of the cycle and 9 psi

Recommended amperage reading range not under load and under load for testing of the pump motor (EMP) for each model.
Modelamperage range
EMP-200 2 - 5 A
EMP-500 3 - 8 A
EMP-1500 3 - 11 A
Adequate volts for each contactor in the electrical box (which legs should be 220v and which should be 115v). If we have a stinger leg, what should it be?

Measure the voltage between the cables of the following colors with a multimeter.

Color AColor BVoltage
BlackWhite220v
Blackred220v
Whitered220v
Green
Note: The voltage should not drop below 205 or rise above 230 for the following tests except green

Stinger's leg is Red

What are the high and low freon shield pressures at which the sensor of each machine and under what conditions can they be changed?

The pressure setting is High when condensed in air for all machines must be 350 psi, when the machine is condensed by water the protection occurs at high pressure at 310 psi, machines are protected by low pressure at 2 pounds No range is movable, if the place lacks ventilation, If the room where it operates is too hot, a way to cool them must be found, there is a risk of compressor damage if protected above 350 psi, compressor damage would release oil in the system hampering proper operation

- The setting of the water valve in which all the machines are programmed. Is the gray valve handle always programmed to the same setting?

This valve must always be programmed at number 3, which is exactly where the water circulation is cut off, once it releases, that pressure must be between 260-280 psi, it can be adjusted at the same time. number 2 this will allow you to access the water at a lower pressure, that is, it will release at 240-250 psi, it is recommended that you always drive to number 3 just as it leaves the factory

Possible problems with the settings of the water valves and the connections for the cooling towers and some adjustments that can be made by a technician
  • In the wrong way, the tower outlet was connected to the water inlet, that is, it was connected in reverse
  • Obstruction of the tower inlet valve by garbage or objects foreign to the water circulation system
  • The fan pushes the air into the tower instead of pulling it out
  • Air bubbles inside the pump
- A table with the HP of the compressor of each model, the suction pressure of the cylinder, the head pressure, the refrigerant charge, and the water consumption working at 80% of its capacity.

Filter cleaning.
  • The machine must be out of operation
  • Locate the pump suction line
  • Close the orange suction handle
  • Then locate the pump discharge line, close the orange pump discharge handle
  • Locate filter "Y" which is a hexagonal bronze plug
  • Loosen the cap and remove the internal sieve, clean any residue, put it back in position, replace the bronze cap
  • Open the two orange handles

Note: It is not necessary to remove the glycol from the tub, because for that the two handles are closed, repeat this every time a low glycol recirculation is noticed
EMP

Trouble Shooting

Web Service Manual in three languages ​​for the Emerymark EMP line paleteros equipment, if you have any situation or question that is not described or answered in the manual, you can leave your data in the form below and a technician will contact you at brevity

Lack of Cooling:

There may be an obstruction or deficiency in the circulation in the cooling system of the Pallet Equipment, Check the Pump Filter for if there is any residue trapped inside, check the condition of the pump itself and compressor, Take actions as observed, check percentage of water in Glycol, recommendation 50% glycol - 50% water

Long Cooling Time

This can occur due to poor circulation in the cooling system, by not leaving an adequate distance to the sides of the machine that allows the correct flow of air, due to a very high temperature in the environment of the machine, due to a coolant leak or due to the use of a glycol of incorrect graduation, remember that the correct gradualness of glycol is 50% - 50% Glycol, it can be used a gradualness different from Glycol, but it must always be greater than 50% never less

Single-phase equipment Damage to the starting capacitor

Installation of very thin wiring for the equipment or very low voltage supply

Glycol Circulation Problem in Tub

Due to a low level of Glycol, remembering that the level of Glycol must exceed the one indicated passing the absorption slots so that the pump does not suck air, dirty or clogged filters, presence of garbage or residues in the circulation of the cooling system

the machines pump does not start
  • Equipment polarity is reversed (this in three-phase equipment, single-phase equipment should not have this problem)
  • Thermal pump protector activated
Glycol leak in palette

If while using your equipment you notice that the machine is leaking or that the Glycol is running out too fast we are most likely dealing with a leak of Glycol, There are several causes for which a Glycol leak can occur, for example, a broken gasket, a loose pipe or even a problem directly in the pump, For this, the source of the leaks must be checked with the exposed system, once By identifying it, we can proceed to solve the problem.

Another reason would be the use of the pump without Glycol, this can cause the mechanical seal of the same to be damaged due to lack of lubrication

Obstruction of the pump filter or circulation of the same paddle

Due to residues present inside the cooling system, constant and conscientious care of the equipment is recommended to avoid the fall of residues inside it.

EMP

Preventive use and Maintenance for EMP Equipment

Prevention is better than regretting and there are actions that do not cost us much but save us a lot, so why wait for a technician's visit to fix our equipment, if we can take care of them and have them in the best condition

  • - Keep the sides of the machine separated from the walls to allow the correct flow of air
  • Keep solid objects such as "popsicle sticks", pieces of fruit, etc ... outside the Glycol tub, if in any case any of these objects accidentally fall into the tub and enter the circulation of the Glycol system. cooling, turn off the compressor, then the pump, disconnect the equipment, remove the side covers, remove the filter from the pump and clean the unwanted object, reset the machine, use normally
  • -Use the equipment with the Glycol always at the indicated level that is passing the absorption and return slots of the Glycol
  • Always use Glycol of the correct gradualness, which is 50% Glycol 50% Water, you can use a Glycol graduation greater than 50%, never less
  • -Keep the machine always level at 0 degrees of inclination with respect to the ground
  • Never use the machine without Glycol or Water, the lack of liquid in the cooling system will cause at least air bubbles in the pump and compressor, for a longer use it could damage the gaskets of different parts of the system. machine which leads to Glycol leakage
  • Turn on the paleteros equipment correctly, turn on the pump and wait for it to suck, start and remain stable, when this happens a green light will be observed on the machine's control panel, turn on the compressor
  • -Lubrication of Gaskets at the time of Installation
  • -purge the cooling system whenever necessary (contaminated glycol, pump with air)
